text: The 2011 South Australian National Football League season was the 132nd season of the top-level Australian rules football competition in South Australia. The season opened on the 2 April with the opening fixture between and , and concluded on 9 October with the Grand Final, in which the Minor Premiers went on to lose to who recorded its 3rd premiership, winning by 3 points. , , , also made the top (final) five teams and participated in the finals series. , , , all missed the top five, with the last of those finishing last to record its 19th wooden spoon. ==Premiership season== ===Round 1=== ===Round 2=== ===Round 3=== ===Round 4=== ==Ladder== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align: center; font-size: 90%; width: 60%" |- | colspan="10" style="background: #EBEBEB;" | {| border="0" width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" |- style="background: #EBEBEB;" | width="25%" style="border: 0;" | | style="border: 0; font-size: 115%;" | 2011 SANFL Ladder | width="25%" style="border: 0;" | |} |- style="text-align: center; font-size: 90%;" ! !!
